alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 12 at 12:50PM MST until August 12 at 2:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 215 PM MST. * At 1249 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Sonoran National Monument to 9 miles northeast of Estrella to near Estrella Sailport to Maricopa to 8 miles southwest of Olberg to 12 miles west of Casa Grande, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 160 and 187. AZ Interstate 8 near mile marker 163. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 145 and 163. Locations impacted include... Chandler, Casa Grande, Sun Lakes, Maricopa, Bapchule, Estrella Sailport, Olberg, Firebird Lake, Stanfield, Ak- Chin Village, Sacaton and Santan. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
